name: Stir Fry Sauce (with Homemade Date Syrup)

ingredients.notes: Medjool preferred, or any soft variety

instructions: Prepare the date syrup: If your dates are dry, soak them in hot water for 10–15 minutes, then drain.
Add pitted dates and 1 cup of water to a blender or food processor. Add lemon juice if using.
Blend until smooth, adding more water a tablespoon at a time only if needed. You should get 1¼ to 1½ cups of smooth syrup.
Optional: For a more syrupy texture, simmer the mixture for 10–15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
In a large bowl or jar, whisk together the soy sauce, rice vinegar, all of the prepared date syrup, sesame oil, ginger, garlic, and sriracha (if using).
If using cornstarch to thicken the sauce, mix 1 tbsp cornstarch with 4 tbsp water, then stir into the sauce mixture.
Use immediately in stir-fries, or store in the fridge for up to 1 week. Shake or stir before using.
